Key Match Events: The Lakers went on a 21-6 run in the second quarter and never looked back.
Anthony Edwards scored 27 points on 10-25 shooting, with the Lakers making him work for every point he got.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts favored the Lakers to win based on their recent performance and defensive game plan.
The Lakers' coaching staff installed a lot of defensive strategies in the last three days and practiced them, which helped the team execute the game plan.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Davis praised the team's defensive game plan as elite and said they executed it well.
JJ Redick said his team did a phenomenal job of executing their game plan and that it was a little bit opponent-specific.
Rui Hachimura emphasized the importance of the team's defensive performance, saying they were more locked in on defense and made Anthony Edwards work for every point he got.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers forced the Timberwolves into 16 turnovers, scoring 19 points on those changes of possession.
The Lakers dominated inside, outscoring the Timberwolves 72-40 in the paint.
The Lakers' fastbreak was impressive, with Rui Hachimura noting it was a key factor in the team's win.
Others: The game was a crucial win for the Lakers, who had not won a season-opening game since 2016.
The Lakers will face the Phoenix Suns on Friday, and it will be interesting to see if they can continue their defensive momentum.
